intro: Borreria asperula, commonly known as rough borreria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. This plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers and hairy, often grayish foliage. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Borreria asperula is a perennial shrub that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
